H0.text: Solar energy and ocean systems are the systems interacting in the description that sunlight penetrates the top several meters of marine water, where most plant and animal life exists.

H1.text: Solar energy and weather systems are interacting in the description where sunlight penetrates the top several meters of marine water, supporting most plant and animal life.

H2.text: Weather systems and ocean systems are the systems interacting in the description of sunlight penetrating the top several meters of marine water, where most plant and animal life exists.

H3.text: Solar energy, ocean systems, and weather systems are the systems interacting in the description that sunlight can penetrate the top several meters of marine water, where most plant and animal life exists.

A4.text: Solar radiation is absorbed by the Earth's land surface, oceans – which cover about 71% of the globe – and atmosphere.

A5.text: Warm air containing evaporated water from the oceans rises, causing atmospheric circulation or convection.
